Node.definition: literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to restore the fortunes (of a nation)
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to lower|to let down|to take down|to bring down|to take off (ornaments)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to move from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= valley; another name for Kidron (קִדְרֹון) Valley, ◄ east of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans divide an object (or range of objects) into portions and share them out among each other
= action by which an object is caused to move from someone's hands toward a surface or place nearby
= the process of arriving at a decision based on casting the lot
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior
= a female child (יֶלֶד)
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= town; ◄ on the Phoenician coast; ► famous as sea port
= town; ◄ Phoenician city north of Tyre (צֹר) famous as a seaport and sometimes referred to as Great Sidon; marked the northern boundary of the Promised Land
= a territorial division

= land of the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי) situated along the coast of the Meditteranean and concentrated around the cities of Gaza (עַזָּה) Gath (גַּת) Ekron (עֶקְרֹון) Ashdod (אַשְׁדֹּוד) and Ashkelon (אַשְׁקְלֹון)
= action by which humans or deities deal with other humans of deities according to their actions, which could be either by punishing them or by giving them a reward
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= process by which an event takes place quickly and without delay
= action by which humans or deities act without delay

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
= action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value
= state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

literally: children of a town, region, nation; hence: = people, animals, or products that are inhabitants of or originating from a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the offspring of that place
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= descendant of Javan (יָוָן)
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= people; ◄ descendants or inhabitants of Sheba (שְׁבָא)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to convoke (a holy event)|to declare (a holy event)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans call their community together for an event with a religious character, such as worship, fasting, or a holy war
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms
= causative action by which a craftsman uses a hammer to alter the shape a metal object to be used for a different purpose
exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= knife or metal blade, sometimes attached to a long wooden handle; ► used for cutting away or cutting back unproductive branches so they can produce better
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer
= state in which humans have run out of physical strength

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which an event is performed quickly

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite

= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time

= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans stretch out their hand, which holds an object, in order to do something with that object
= large, curved knife with a short wooden handle (15 20 centimeters); ► used for cutting grain
= process by which fruits or grains grow to maturity, as a result of the heat of the sun, until they are ready to be harvested
read ירד (ירד)
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat (יֶקֶב) ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment
= large container; ◄ normally hewn out of stone and part of a winepress; ► where the grape juice is collected
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= a large group of people
= a large group of people
literally: Valley of Decision; = valley, also known as Kidron (קִדְרֹון) Valley or Valley of Jehoshaphat (יְהֹושָׁפָט) ◄ located east of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: Valley of Decision; = valley, also known as Kidron (קִדְרֹון) Valley or Valley of Jehoshaphat (יְהֹושָׁפָט) ◄ located east of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night
= process by which celestial bodyies stop producing or reflecting light

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war
= action by which someone brings an event to an end
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to come out (of a certain place); hence: = process by which liquids flow from a certain place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= location; ◄ Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) Valley
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
literally: to pour out blood; hence: = to wound or kill an animate being
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which a place or area has been made the home of humans
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished|to avenge|to take vengeance

= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment
